Summary Technical professional with 15+ years of experience in process re-engineering and solution design for global SAP projects. Offer proven leadership skills and excel at collaborating across diverse levels, functions, and groups. Skilled in architecting, designing, testing, and deploying effective solutions based on changing business needs. Apply critical thinking skills and logical approach to determine requirements and deliver process and system improvements. Consistent track record of contributing to multi-year strategic enterprise programs focused on optimizing global business processes and expanding capabilities for Intel Corporation. Ensure delivery of projects within time constraints and specifications. Highlights include: 
 
-Led upgrade/transition of factory spare parts application from legacy SAP system to SAP ECC 6.0 across 22 factories worldwide; steered and mentored 20-person team spanning US, Ireland, Malaysia, Israel, and India.  
 
-Proved vital to mapping company-to-company indirect procurement process for M&A project, negotiating and gaining buy-in to use existing Intel process, which resulted in significant time, resource, and cost savings. 
 
-Led team to design application that automates creation of SRM operational contracts using business modeling tool to integrate diverse systems into service-oriented architecture. Summary As part of an IT rotation leadership program, I solve business problems using technical solutions.  
My projects range from providing internal customers with analytics tools, to reporting on external revenue streams, in addition to providing reports for accounts payable for suppliers.  
I have received numerous recognition awards for my work within IT, and I'm always looking for alternative methods to contribute to Intel with my work, and volunteering efforts.  
 
I lead the Arizona chapter of IT community events, specifically for recent college graduates and new interns to promote networking usually through lunches, happy hours, and workshops among other various entertainment activities. 
I have been involved in recruiting efforts with UCLA, as well as mentoring new analysts onto my team. 
 
In the past, I worked as a web analytics and e-commerce analyst for U-Haul International focusing on creating trending web traffic reports for key department heads, driving web design change and campaigns for improved web experience. Additionally as a graphic designer for ASUonline, I created custom graphics and design specifications for online courses as well as provide quality assurance for media, both video and image, for inclusion in online educational materials. 
 
I graduated from the W.P. Carey School of Business in Computer Information Systems from ASU in 2013. 
 
My professional goals are to continue my work as a Systems Analyst, improving my skills with SQL, Excel, VBA, and other database and reporting tools. I also want to further my efforts to be involved with Intel's community through event facilitation, and volunteer efforts in my community.
